title: Augusta County: Jedediah Hotchkiss to Sara A. Hotchkiss, March 15, 1863
summary: Hotchkiss writes about the horrible destruction of war, the bad weather in camp, and the environment around the camp. He comments on the farm and affairs back home, and a possible commission for himself.
keywords: Troop Movement, Church/Religious Activity, Agriculture, Military Authority, African Americans, Slavery, American Civil War
